title: Firefox automatic updating
content: Ok. The update downloaded 2 1/2 days ago. I've used Firefox since that download. It didn't install until now. 2 1/2 days later. Why the long delay? And why don't you have something show up in the banner or toolbar that designates that an upload to Firefox is happening? Now, we all have to guess why Firefox is behaving slow and erratic, close and re-open, and check for version.
creator: steveaaayyy

title: Restore bookmarks on desktop from already logged-in app?
content: I've been a Firefox user for years on both my (Windows) laptop and (Android) phone. I have recently had to unexpectedly factory reset my laptop and I discovered upon doing so that my Mozilla password in my password keeper isn't up to date - I had to reset my password, and as such I'm currently using "my" Mozilla account with no bookmarks or history available. However, I am still logged into my Firefox account on my phone, with all my history and bookmarks safely saved on there. Is there any way for me to migrate that information back to my desktop app? Verify my desktop account somehow?? I really don't want to lose all my bookmarks, so any info for how to restore that to my desktop account would be very appreciated. Thank you!
creator: tzamozdra

title: Norad Santa Tracker doesn't display properly in Firefox.
content:
Hi. The annual NORAD Santa Tracker website does not function properly under Firefox. While there are no issues with the 3D rendering itself, the 3D map is squished vertically toward the left side of the page. It appears to be defaulting to a mobile browser view. The only extension I have installed is uBlock Origin, and I turned it off for the NORAD Santa website, and the display issue persists.

Opening the site under Safari shows the Santa tracker taking up the entire browser window as it should do.

I'm currently on Mac OS Sonoma using the latest version of Firefox 121.0
creator: wb8979

title: does FF use webview2 ?
content:
Greetings , does FF use webview2 ? I am working on Windows11 with webview2 msEdge and PureBasic . But having difficulty getting proper support . I am building a freeware Kidsafe-Browser , that utilizes a File of Trusted Sites . Everything works great except when I come to youtube.com . For youtube , I would like to capture the URL when on-page-link is clicked . But can't get the support to finish this last step . https://www.purebasic.fr/english

So I am wondering , does FF have something similar to Windows msEdge webview2 that will allow a programmer to interact with Browser progress ?

Thanks for your help...
creator: vmars316
